byline.contributor: Marlise Simons contributed reporting from Paris, and Adam Nossiter from Tripoli, Libya.

abstract: Luis Moreno-Ocampo, top prosecutor of the International Criminal Court has been in indirect contact with Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi, fugitive son of Libya's deposed leader; Qaddafi maintains he is innocent, but Moreno-Ocamp is urging him to surrender.
snippet: The top prosecutor of the International Criminal Court has been in indirect contact with Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi about turning himself in, although Mr. Qaddafi maintains he is innocent.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

lead_paragraph: The top prosecutor of the International Criminal Court has been in indirect contact with Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi about turning himself in, although Mr. Qaddafi maintains he is innocent.

headline.main: Qaddafi Son Maintains Innocence as Criminal Court Cites Indirect Talks
headline.print_headline: Criminal Court Cites Indirect Talks With Qaddafi Son
headline.seo: Criminal Court Cites Indirect Talks With Qaddafi Son
